facts.text: Album of the Year: Bad Bunny won for 'DebÃ­ Tirar MÃ¡s Fotos', the first all-Spanish winner.
Record of the Year: Kendrick Lamar & SZA took the trophy for 'Luther'.
Song of the Year: Billie Eilish & Finneas won for writing 'Wildflower'.
Best New Artist: Olivia Dean won, beating out a competitive field.
Best Pop Vocal Album: Lady Gaga won for 'Mayhem'.
Best Dance Pop Recording: Lady Gaga also won for 'Abracadabra'.
Best Dance/Electronic Album: FKA twigs took home the award for 'EUSEXUA'.
Best Rap Album: Kendrick Lamar won for 'GNX'.
Best Rap Song: 'Luther' by Kendrick Lamar & SZA took the songwriting honor.
Best Melodic Rap Performance: 'Luther' secured its second genre win here.
Best Rap Performance: Kendrick Lamar won solo for the title track 'GNX'.
Best R&B Album: Leon Thomas won for 'MUTT'.
Best Rock Album: Turnstile won for 'Never Enough'.
Best Rock Performance: Linkin Park won for 'From Zero'.
Best Rock Song: Nine Inch Nails won for 'As Alive As You Need Me to Be'.
Best Metal Performance: Turnstile won for 'BIRDS'.
Best Alternative Album: The Cure won for 'Songs of a Lost World'.
Best Alternative Performance: The Cure also won for 'Alone'.
Best Country Album: Jelly Roll won for 'Beautifully Broken'.
Producer of the Year: Jack Antonoff won for the fifth consecutive time.
Best Music Film: Steven Spielberg won for 'Music By John Williams', completing his EGOT.
Best Song for Visual Media: 'Golden' (KPop Demon Hunters) became the first K-Pop win.
Bad Bunny's 'DebÃ­ Tirar MÃ¡s Fotos' is the first all-Spanish album to win Album of the Year.
Kendrick Lamar & SZA won Record of the Year for 'Luther', a track that spent 8 weeks at #1.
Billie Eilish and Finneas won Song of the Year for 'Wildflower', their third win in this category.
Olivia Dean won Best New Artist, becoming the first British winner since Sam Smith.
Steven Spielberg is now an EGOT winner after taking Best Music Film for 'Music By John Williams'.
He was the night's biggest winner, taking home 5 Grammys in total.
He officially became the most-awarded rapper in Grammy history, surpassing Jay-Z and Kanye West.
His album 'GNX' won Best Rap Album, continuing his streak of winning for every major studio release.
He shared two wins with SZA for their chart-topping collaboration 'Luther'.
During his speech, he thanked Compton and the 'new generation' of west coast hip-hop.
His album 'DebÃ­ Tirar MÃ¡s Fotos' made history as the first Spanish-language Album of the Year.
He dedicated his award to Puerto Rico, stating 'We are human beings, and we are Americans.'
This win marks his fourth Grammy Award overall, but his first in the General Field.
He celebrated the win by lighting a cigar on stage before walking off.
The album was praised for blending reggaeton with 70s salsa and trap influences.
SZA won Record of the Year and Best Rap Song for her feature on 'Luther'.
She became the first female artist to win Best Rap Song since Megan Thee Stallion in 2021.
Her vocals on the track were described by critics as the 'soul of the record'.
She wore a stunning dress made entirely of recycled ocean plastic mesh.
SZA has now won Grammys in Pop, R&B, Rap, and General fields.
The siblings won Song of the Year for 'Wildflower' from the album 'Hit Me Hard and Soft'.
This is their third win in the Song of the Year category, a rare songwriting feat.
Finneas accepted the award barefoot, maintaining a personal tradition.
Billie thanked her vocal coach in her speech for helping her hit the high notes in 'Wildflower'.
They beat out massive hits from Taylor Swift and Post Malone for the trophy.
Olivia Dean won Best New Artist, capping off a breakout year in the UK and US.
She is the first British artist to win this specific award in over a decade.
Her debut album 'Messy' was cited as a major influence on the voting academy.
She performed as part of the massive 8-person Best New Artist medley.
In her speech, she shouted out her grandmother who bought her her first guitar.
Spielberg completed his EGOT (Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, Tony) with a Best Music Film win.
The winning film, 'Music By John Williams', is a documentary about his longtime composer.
He jokingly thanked the mechanical shark from 'Jaws' for starting his musical career.
At 79 years old, he is one of the oldest individuals to complete an EGOT.
He received a standing ovation from the music industry crowd upon winning.
She won Best Pop Vocal Album for her 2025 release, 'Mayhem'.
Her hit single 'Abracadabra' secured the Grammy for Best Dance Pop Recording.
Gaga's performance was described as 'manic' and 'theatrical,' featuring a surrealist stage design.
She arrived on the red carpet in a custom outfit that appeared to be made of liquid chrome.
This year's wins brought her career total to over 15 Grammy Awards.
She performed her hit 'Manchild' on a stage built to look like a retro-futuristic airport terminal.
The climax of her performance involved her releasing a live dove from a scaled-down airplane fuselage.
She was nominated for multiple 'Big Four' categories following her massive breakout year.
Her performance was praised for its intricate choreography and 'campy' humor.
Carpenter's 'Manchild' has become a staple of her 2025-2026 world tour setlist.
Bieber performed a stripped-down, acoustic version of his hit song 'Yukon'.
In a bold fashion choice, he performed while wearing only grey boxers and socks.
The minimalist performance used a single loop-pedal, a style often associated with Ed Sheeran.
Despite the simple setup, it was cited by critics as one of the most vocally impressive sets of the night.
The 'Yukon' performance marked his return to the Grammy stage after a multi-year hiatus.
RosÃ© opened the 68th Grammy Awards, the first K-Pop soloist to ever hold that slot.
She performed the global smash hit 'APT.' alongside Bruno Mars.
Her vocal run at the end of the song lasted 12 seconds, setting a personal record.
She wore a modern reinterpretation of a traditional Hanbok for the red carpet.
Confetti shaped like miniature apartment buildings fell during her finale.
Bruno Mars joined RosÃ© to open the show with their duet 'APT.'.
He played a traditional Korean drum during the song's bridge.
Mars was seen teaching RosÃ© a few of his signature dance moves during rehearsal footage.
He wore a customized silk jacket with 'APT' embroidered on the back.
This performance marks his return to the Grammy stage after Silk Sonic's sweep.
He led an emotional heavy metal tribute to the 'Prince of Darkness,' Ozzy Osbourne.
He was joined on stage by rock legends Slash, Duff McKagan, and Chad Smith.
The group performed a pyrotechnic-heavy rendition of Black Sabbath's 'War Pigs'.
Post Malone, known for genre-blending, wore a classic leather biker vest for the set.
The performance honored Osbourne, who passed away in July 2025.
The Guns N' Roses legend played lead guitar for the Ozzy Osbourne tribute.
He played his iconic 'Jessica' Les Paul Standard guitar during the set.
Slash and Ozzy were close friends and collaborators for decades.
He delivered a 2-minute guitar solo that silenced the entire arena.
Slash wore his signature top hat, which he tipped to the screen showing Ozzy.
Duff provided the bass lines for the heavy metal tribute to Ozzy Osbourne.
He played alongside his longtime bandmate Slash for the performance.
Duff wore a shirt featuring a vintage photo of him and Ozzy from the 90s.
His bass tone was praised for capturing the original Black Sabbath heaviness.
He was seen hugging Kelly Osbourne in the audience immediately after the set.
The Red Hot Chili Peppers drummer anchored the rhythm for the Ozzy tribute.
Chad Smith had previously worked with Ozzy on his final studio album.
He broke three drumsticks during the high-energy performance of 'War Pigs'.
His drum kit was elevated 10 feet in the air on a hydraulic riser.
He wore a sleeveless jumpsuit similar to what he wears for RHCP concerts.
The legendary band won Best Alternative Music Album for 'Songs of a Lost World'.
These were the first Grammy wins in the band's 50-year career.
Frontman Robert Smith gave a typically brief 10-word acceptance speech.
They also won Best Alternative Performance for the song 'Alone'.
The wins validate their massive 2025 comeback tour and album.
Turnstile dominated the rock categories, winning Best Rock Album for 'Never Enough'.
They also won Best Metal Performance for 'BIRDS', proving their crossover appeal.
The band accepted the award in matching pastel suits.
They are the first hardcore band to win Best Rock Album in Grammy history.
Lead singer Brendan Yates did a cartwheel on the red carpet.
Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross won Best Rock Song for 'As Alive As You Need Me to Be'.
The song is featured on the soundtrack for the film 'Tron: Ares'.
This marks another win in a long line of soundtrack successes for the duo.
The track features a unique blend of industrial rock and synthwave.
They did not attend the ceremony, reportedly working on a new score.
Linkin Park won Best Rock Performance for 'From Zero', their comeback anthem.
This is the band's first Grammy win with their new lineup.
Mike Shinoda gave a heartfelt speech about grief and moving forward.
The band wore matching silver lapel pins shaped like their new logo.
They were praised for successfully reinventing their sound for a new era.
Lauryn Hill served as the Musical Director for the tribute to D'Angelo and Roberta Flack.
She performed a mashup of 'Killing Me Softly' and 'Untitled (How Does It Feel)'.
The tribute performance lasted 15 minutes, one of the longest in show history.
She was joined on stage by a 20-piece orchestra.
Her vocals were praised as 'timeless' and 'technically flawless'.
John Legend played piano and sang during the Roberta Flack portion of the tribute.
He performed a soulful rendition of 'The First Time Ever I Saw Your Face'.
Legend wore a velvet tuxedo that channeled 1970s soul style.
He and Lauryn Hill harmonized for the finale of the tribute.
As an EGOT winner himself, he presented the Best Music Film award later.
Wyclef made a surprise appearance during Lauryn Hill's tribute set.
This marked a rare mini-reunion of The Fugees on the Grammy stage.
He played his signature electric guitar during the bridge of 'Killing Me Softly'.
Wyclef shouted 'One Love!' to the crowd before exiting the stage.
His appearance was kept a complete secret from the press until the show.
Andre 3000 made a silent, unannounced cameo during the D'Angelo tribute.
He played a custom Mayan double-flute in the background of the set.
He wore a bright orange jumpsuit and a knitted beanie.
He did not sing or rap, strictly contributing instrumental ambiance.
Social media exploded with memes about his calm demeanor during the chaos.
Trevor Noah hosted the Grammys for his sixth and officially final time.
He opened the show with a monologue poking fun at AI and ticket prices.
Noah received a special commendation from the Academy for his years of hosting.
He handed out flowers to BeyoncÃ© and Meryl Streep during a commercial break.
His final sign-off was a simple 'Goodnight, and keep listening.'
The iconic duo reunited to present the Record of the Year award.
They walked out to the 'Mamma Mia!' soundtrack, dancing slightly.
Cher joked about her autotune legacy while Streep pretended to sing opera.
Their banter was scripted but felt incredibly natural and warm.
They announced Kendrick Lamar and SZA as the winners.
Country legend Reba McEntire led the emotional 'In Memoriam' segment.
She performed a new song titled 'Trailblazer' written for the occasion.
Reba fought back tears while the names of fallen country stars appeared.
She was joined by Lukas Nelson for the second half of the song.
Her performance was praised for its simplicity and grace.
Jack Antonoff won Producer of the Year, Non-Classical for the 5th year in a row.
He produced tracks on three of the Album of the Year nominated projects.
Antonoff thanked his wife and frequent collaborator Margaret Qualley.
He wore his signature thick-rimmed glasses and a cropped tuxedo jacket.
Critics are calling his winning streak unprecedented in modern pop history.
Killer Mike presented the Best Rap Album award to Kendrick Lamar.
He famously swept the Rap categories himself two years prior.
Mike gave a passionate speech about the importance of Southern Hip-Hop.
He called Kendrick's win a 'passing of the torch' moment.
He wore a custom suit embroidered with the names of civil rights leaders.
Paramore received the Global Impact Award during the pre-telecast ceremony.
Hayley Williams gave a speech about women in the alternative rock scene.
The band is the first female-fronted group to receive this specific honor.
They announced a new scholarship fund for young female musicians.
The trio posed with their award in a playful, punk-rock stance.
